review_title: one of the best community colleges for returning adults to higher education in the country
job_title: Professor in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros:
1. great place to work in service of the development of the future professionals and citizens of our state and county--great mission.
2. great place to develop academic content to forward lifelong learning, independent thinking, civic responsibility and duty, respect and tolerance for all points of view, and furtherance of equity and fairness as well-worth social values.
3. great place to work in teams and independently on academic development of general education of all our students and to further strengthen hard and soft knowledge, skills and abilities of our work force across industries.
4. great regard for professional conduct and equitable treatment across all stakeholders and functions of our college organization--collegial work environment; it is all about our students advancement and wellness.
cons: none ... really! I really mean it: do not look for a perfect work environment, it does not exist. it is unrealistic and naive to believe that a work environment can be a garden of eden. DVC's work environment is fantastic.

job_title: MESA Tutor in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: It's fun to give back to the school you have grown up in, and to get involved with the students, professors, and people who make up the college rather than just being a student. It's an awesome way to give back to your community, make a salary for necessities in life, and to understand the material. You also get experience on how to explain a subject to someone, so if your looking to be an educator such as a professor, tutoring can be a very rewarding job.
cons: I truly don't see any downsides of working on campus. It's fun, and is what I want to do. I love what I do, and if your one that likes to give back to your community working as a student worker on campus or student tutor is a good way to do it because you can help explain to students misconceptions that you may have had, and help the other students who are taking the same courses that you did get around some of the frustrations that you may have had, which is rewarding.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Danville, CA
pros: Short shifts, laid back environment
cons: Locked into your schedule, hard to change recurring hours

review_title: Think Twice about Taking a Part-time Teaching Job
job_title: Adjunct Professor in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: Adjunct teaching anywhere has some pros: for a part-time job it pays fairly well, you have some flexibility with your schedule and lots of autonomy
cons: As an adjunct instructor you are basically a second-class citizen.  There is no institutional support, no one cares about your professional development or rewards you for working hard.  If you're interested in contributing to the college beyond the classroom, you're welcome to, but you have to do it for free.  You will not have coworkers you see regularly--it's a pretty lonely job.  Too many intelligent and caring people fall into this academic trap, and until colleges don't have a steady supply of cheap labor, it will continue.  Please consider using your talents for the benefit of an organization that does not take advantage of you.

job_title: English Tutor in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: Coworkers, tutees and supervisors where great! They all became really good friends who helped each other out whenever we weren't sure about something. There was a tea maker in the back room too, along with staff and thankful tutees bringing in desserts and snack. I was usually in the back room even when there wasn't an appointment just to hangout. Tutoring was pretty easy; a lot of handouts you can use to supplement your lessons.  Flexible hours, great for a student.
cons: Although I actually enjoyed it, I know others didn't: to be hired, your first semester you have to take a training class. It's one unit course. You also don't have much say on he many hours you want since it really just depends on the students and if the supervisor likes you.

review_title: DVC is a great place to be an Adjunct Instructor.
job_title: Adjunct Instructor, English in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: The administration is very hands off in terms of what instructors teach, so you can choose whatever books/materials you like, and teach your own way. There is lots of independence. I worked in the English Department and it is full of friendly and interesting instructors, especially the part-timers/adjuncts.
cons: They do not hire full time instructors often, so it is hard to get a full time position. Also, the hourly pay may seem high, but it only applies to the time that you are teaching in the classroom and to office hours, so the actual hourly rate is  not very high.

review_title: Adjunct Instructors are not paid livable wages
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in San Ramon, CA
pros:
You don't work long hours.
Its fun to work with students and in the college environment.
cons: You only get paid for the time spent in class. That means you don't get paid to grade papers, prepare lectures/handouts, or ANYTHING that is not during the 1 and 25 minutes you are teaching to the students.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: Most of the students are great and serious about getting their degrees.
cons: The complexity of the bureaucracy is amazing.  Part-time faculty have very few rights and almost impossible to get onto insurance benefits.  Full-time faculty have the right to toss you out at any time and take your class (and all your syllabus info) for themselves.

job_title: Teacher in Pleasanton, CA
pros: Not sure yet.  Don't know what to write here.
cons: They send out an email saying they are need of teachers.  They interview you, hire you, but you never get to teach.  Was hired a few years ago and never got to teach.  You ask them about it and their response is this has happened with other teachers as well.  Why even hire people? What are they up to?  There are all these new openings and you apply for them, and they still don't give you a chance.  Why even hire people?

review_title: Worked in the CS/Math Department as a administrative assistant.
job_title: Student Clerk in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: Great coworkers, good pay for the experience required, flexible hours, close to all my classes, could do homework when I didn't have any work to do.
cons: Really, just not enough hours, I really had a good time working for DVC. I can't think of many bad things to say about the job, it was probably one of the best on campus.

job_title: in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: The environment is pretty nice there in Pleasant Hill. The managers were very nice too.
cons: The hourly wage was very little back then and in Pleasant Hill, although the work was easy and not too busy there.

job_title: Student Assistant in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: Flexible hours allowing students to take multiple classes, do homework, and yet work. The staff is very nice and comprehensive. Also, helps with communication skills and costumer services.
cons: Minimum wage payment due to "student assistant" position. Sometimes, you do not get taken serious by other departments because they consider you a student only.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Pleasant Hill, CA

cons: Definitely a side-job, not a full-time job level of pay

job_title: English Tutor in Pleasant Hill, CA

cons: The pay isn't great. Some of the students are incredibly hard to work with.

pros: Good place to work if you get to work in a department that VALUES its employees...not all do.  Union shop - everyone is paid the same no matter if some employees are doing their job or not.
